BR_text.BRsummary: New optimizer gluonnlp.optimizer.lamb.LAMB is overriding existing optimizer mxnet.optimizer.optimizer.LAMB
BR_text.BRdescription: [2019-11-25T02:55:07.913Z] /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/gluon-nlp-cpu-py3/conda/cpu/py3-master/lib/python3.5/site-packages/mxnet/optimizer/optimizer.py:166: UserWarning: WARNING: New optimizer gluonnlp.optimizer.lamb.LAMB is overriding existing optimizer mxnet.optimizer.optimizer.LAMB

comments_1.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/leezu>@leezu</denchmark-link>
  can you suggest a name for the mxnet lamb optimizer ? I will create a PR to rename it

comments_2.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/access2rohit>@access2rohit</denchmark-link>
  both GluonNLP's and MXNet's  are based on <denchmark-link:https://arxiv.org/pdf/1904.00962.pdf>https://arxiv.org/pdf/1904.00962.pdf</denchmark-link>
 
 So we may just drop the GluonNLP version.
 Do you have any specific concerns about the naming of the MXNet version?

comments_3.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/leezu>@leezu</denchmark-link>
  I don't have concerns about name of MXNet Lamb optimizer. I thought MXNet name was clashing with that of GluonNLP one so I might need to change in MXNet.

comments_4.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/access2rohit>@access2rohit</denchmark-link>
  would it make sense to backport your MXNet PR for MXNet 1.6 release? GluonNLP will depend on MXNet 1.6, so we can't drop the current implementation.
 CC <denchmark-link:https://github.com/eric-haibin-lin>@eric-haibin-lin</denchmark-link>

comments_5.comment_text:
I think the changes have been backported to 1.6 on Dec 10, 2019 <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/commits/v1.6.x>https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/commits/v1.6.x</denchmark-link>
 .

comments_6.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/zburning>@zburning</denchmark-link>
  you can consider working on this (which should fix your issue <denchmark-link:https://github.com/dmlc/gluon-nlp/issues/1085>#1085</denchmark-link>
 ?)
